document_title: Gastric (stomach) bleeding: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Gastrointestinal (GI) bleeding is a common gastrointestinal disorder. The most recognizable sign is blood appearing in stool or vomit but it is not always visible to the naked eye. In addition, stomach bleeding can also cause stools to turn black or tarry. The degree of bleeding will be mild or severe depending on the medical condition, and in many cases it can also affect life.
Currently, imaging technology is increasingly developing, becoming much more sophisticated and modern. Therefore, in necessary cases, doctors can determine the exact cause of stomach bleeding to prescribe appropriate treatment.(2)
